content: @Santiago Pastorino asked me about the possibility of fine-grained LLVM perf tracking, as it relates to rustc. I think there isn't anything like that at the moment, is that right?
I also have a feeling that the LLVM folks are tracking their own perf better than they used to, is that right? If so, do they have any rustc-based benchmarks?
https://llvm-compile-time-tracker.com/ I believe is the equivalent of rust perf page.

There was some effort to keep an eye more closely at Rust from the integration perspective (i.e. did rustc break?) but I'm not aware of anything of the sort for perf, and there's probably less value in doing so given that rustc itself tracks its perf quite meticulously.
rustc isn't necessarily guaranteed to build with llvm head at all times, which complicates any such setup too.
